titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Carl E. Prince photography collection V1987.030
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T14:41-0500

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Carl E. Prince photography collection, V1987.030, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Carl E. Prince photography collection dates from circa 1907 to 1927 and consists of 15 items. The collection contains cabinet cards, tintypes, and photographs. Images in the collection include family portraits; street scenes, possibly in Manhattan or Brooklyn; interior views of a home in the Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood of Brooklyn; an air strip in Newark, N.J.; scenes in Liberty, N.Y.; and unidentified rural landscapes. Portrait subjects are identified by name, and most images are identified by location.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Based on the date range of this collection, all items in the collection will enter the public domain by 2049. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.
